reviews.body:
## Pull request overview

This PR adds a blank line after the module docstring in over 300 Python files across the codebase to improve consistency with PEP 8 style guidelines. The changes also include minor formatting adjustments such as import reordering, line breaks for long function signatures, and replacing dictionary comprehensions with `dict.fromkeys()` where appropriate. Additionally, the PR updates the issues report to reflect current code quality metrics and adds a new HTML dashboard for visualizing code quality issues.

### Key Changes
- Added blank lines after module docstrings across the entire codebase
- Reformatted long lines and function signatures to improve readability
- Reordered imports alphabetically in multiple files
- Updated code quality metrics in `issues-report.md` and added `docs/issues_dashboard.html`

### Reviewed changes

Copilot reviewed 300 out of 371 changed files in this pull request and generated 4 comments.

<details>
<summary>Show a summary per file</summary>

| File | Description |
| ---- | ----------- |
| Multiple Python files (300+) | Added blank line after module docstring for PEP 8 compliance |
| `issues-report.md` | Updated code quality metrics with current Ruff linting results |
| `docs/issues_dashboard.html` | New interactive dashboard for visualizing code quality issues |
| Multiple `__init__.py` files | Reordered imports alphabetically |
| Multiple files with long lines | Broke long function signatures and dictionary comprehensions into multiple lines |
</details>

title: Code quality improvements: PEP 8 formatting, documentation cleanup, and syntax error fixes
